title: Understanding OCD
text: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) is a mental health condition characterized by unwanted and intrusive thoughts (obsessions) and repetitive behaviors or mental acts (compulsions) that a person feels driven to perform.

title: Common Symptoms of OCD
text: People with OCD may experience symptoms such as excessive cleaning, checking, counting, or hoarding. These behaviors are often performed to reduce anxiety or prevent a feared event or situation.

hintAnswer: common form of $$anxiety-related$$ mental disorder wherein a person has recurring thoughts and ideas that make them uncomfortable and anxious
title: Identifying OCD
text: Which of the following best describes obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)?
choices: persistent and excessive worry about everyday events and activities
persistent worry, restlessness, and physical symptoms like fatigue and muscle tension
anxiety reaction to stress that results in a panic attack
common form of $$anxiety-related$$ mental disorder wherein a person has recurring thoughts and ideas that make them uncomfortable and anxious
